All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
ConfigurationController
REST controller for all live (runtime) configurations made to the ExplainableEngineApplication.
Context
The Context class represents and bundles the contextual information for explaining a situation.
ContextService
Component to collect all contextual variables for enriching explanations.
CreateExService
Service hub responsible for building and delivering explanations.
DatabaseController
REST controller for all live (runtime) configurations made to the ExplainableEngineApplication's database.
DatabaseSeeder
The DatabaseSeeder class is responsible for seeding the database with initial data.
DatabaseService
The DatabaseService class provides methods for interacting with the database to perform operations related to rules, errors, users, entities, and occurrences.
Entity
The Entity class represents a Home Assistant entity in a smart home system.
EntityRepository
Repository interface for accessing and managing Entity (Home Assistant entities) in the MongoDB database.
Error
The Error class represents an error in the system.
ErrorRepository
Repository interface for accessing and managing Error entities (errors known about the system) in the MongoDB database.
ExplainableEngineApplication
ExplainableEngineApplication: A prototype of the SmartEx reference architecture for generating user-centric explanations in smart environments (Here: the smart home managing system "Home Assistant").
ExplanationContextMappingService
Component to perform the mapping of context to most appropriate view type, according to mapping policies described in the paper and defined in the packages .ruleBookForRules and .ruleBookForErrors.
ExplanationController
REST controller for providing explanation demanding endpoints.
FindCauseService
Component bundling the functionalities required to determine causes.
HomeAssistantConnectionService
Service to perform retrieval of Home Assistant data.
JsonHandler
Loads JSON files.
LogEntry
Represents a log entry of the Home Assistant application.
Occurrence
The Occurrence enum represents different occurrences (i.e., how often an explanation was generated, i.e., a count encoded as strings).
OccurrenceEntry
The OccurrenceEntry class represents an entry of occurrence information.
OccurrenceEntryRepository
Repository interface for accessing and managing OccurrenceEntry entities in the MongoDB database.
OccurrenceFirstRule
 
OccurrenceFirstRule
 
OccurrenceMoreRule
 
OccurrenceMoreRule
 
OccurrenceSecondRule
 
OccurrenceSecondRule
 
Role
The Role enum represents different roles that a user can have.
Rule
The Rule class represents an automation rule in Home Assistant.
RulebookRule
 
RuleRepository
Repository interface for accessing and managing Rule (i.e., Home Assistant automations) entities in the MongoDB database.
State
The State enum represents different states of a user.
Technicality
The Technicality enum represents different levels of technicality.
TestingObjects
 
TransformationFunctionService
Component that transforms the building blocks of the explanation generation into a natural language explanation.
User
The User class represents a user of the smart home system.
UserRepository
Repository interface for accessing and managing User entities in the MongoDB database.
UserRoleCoworkerRule
 
UserRoleCoworkerRule
 
UserRoleGuestRule
 
UserRoleGuestRule
 
UserRoleOwnerRule
 
UserRoleOwnerRule
 
UserStateBreakRule
 
UserStateBreakRule
 
UserStateMeetingRule
 
UserStateMeetingRule
 
UserStateWorkingRule
 
UserStateWorkingRule
 
UserTechnicalityHighRule
 
UserTechnicalityHighRule
 
UserTechnicalityMediumRule
 
UserTechnicalityMediumRule
 
UserTechnicalityNontechRule
 
UserTechnicalityNontechRule
 
View
The View enum represents different types of explanation represesenations as defined in the paper.
